014package org.microbean.event;
015
016import java.lang.System.Logger;
017
018import java.util.ArrayList;
019import java.util.HashSet;
020import java.util.LinkedList;
021import java.util.List;
022import java.util.Map;
023import java.util.Set;
024
025import javax.lang.model.element.Element;
026import javax.lang.model.element.TypeElement;
027import javax.lang.model.element.TypeParameterElement;
028
029import javax.lang.model.type.ArrayType;
030import javax.lang.model.type.DeclaredType;
031import javax.lang.model.type.PrimitiveType;
032import javax.lang.model.type.TypeKind;
033import javax.lang.model.type.TypeMirror;
034import javax.lang.model.type.TypeVariable;
035import javax.lang.model.type.WildcardType;
036
037import org.microbean.assign.SupertypeList;
038import org.microbean.assign.Types;
039
040import org.microbean.construct.Domain;
041
042import static javax.lang.model.element.Modifier.ABSTRACT;
043
044import static java.lang.System.Logger.Level.WARNING;
045
046import static java.util.HashMap.newHashMap;
047
048import static java.util.Objects.requireNonNull;
049
050import static javax.lang.model.type.TypeKind.ARRAY;
051import static javax.lang.model.type.TypeKind.BOOLEAN;
052import static javax.lang.model.type.TypeKind.DECLARED;
053import static javax.lang.model.type.TypeKind.TYPEVAR;
054import static javax.lang.model.type.TypeKind.VOID;
055import static javax.lang.model.type.TypeKind.WILDCARD;
056
057/**
058 * A utility for working with <dfn>event types</dfn>.
059 *
060 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson" target="_top">Laird Nelson</a>
061 *
062 * @see #eventTypes(TypeMirror, Object)
063 *
064 * @see #legalEventType(TypeMirror)
065 */
066public final class EventTypes extends Types {
067
068
069  /*
070   * Static fields.
071   */
072
073
074  private static final Logger LOGGER = System.getLogger(EventTypes.class.getName());
075
076
077  /*
078   * Constructors.
079   */
080
081
082  /**
083   * Creates a new {@link EventTypes}.
084   *
085   * @param domain a {@link Domain}; must not be {@code null}
086   *
087   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code domain} is {@code null}
088   */
089  public EventTypes(final Domain domain) {
090    super(domain);
091  }
092
093
094  /*
095   * Instance methods.
096   */
097
098
099  /**
100   * Returns an {@link EventTypeList} of {@linkplain #legalEventType(TypeMirror) legal event types} that the supplied
101   * {@link TypeMirror} bears.
102   *
103   * <p>The returned {@link EventTypeList} may be {@linkplain EventTypeList#isEmpty() empty}.</p>
104   *
105   * @param typeArgumentSource a {@link TypeMirror} used for <dfn>{@index "event type argument inference"}</dfn>; must
106   * not be {@code null}; must {@linkplain TypeMirror#getKind() have a kind} of either {@link TypeKind#ARRAY} or {@link
107   * TypeKind#DECLARED}
108   *
109   * @param event the event object whose event types should be returned; must not be {@code null}
110   *
111   * @return an {@link EventTypeList}; never {@code null}
112   *
113   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
114   *
115   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code typeArgumentSource} is not legal
116   */
117  public final EventTypeList eventTypes(final TypeMirror typeArgumentSource, final Object event) {
118    return new EventTypeList(this.supertypes(this.eventType(typeArgumentSource, event.getClass()), EventTypes::legalEventType));
119  }
120
121  // This MUST NOT become public.
122  final TypeMirror eventType(final TypeMirror typeArgumentSource, final Class<?> eventClass) {
123    if (eventClass == void.class) {
124      // Optimization: void.class is never the answer.
125      throw new IllegalArgumentException("eventClass: " + eventClass);
126    }
127    if (eventClass.isPrimitive()) {
128      // Optimization: if it is primitive, there's no further work to be done.
129      return this.domain().primitiveType(eventClass.getCanonicalName());
130    }
131    int dimensions = 0;
132    Class<?> c = eventClass;
133    while (c.isArray()) {
134      c = c.getComponentType();
135      ++dimensions;
136    }
137    final Domain d = this.domain();
138    TypeMirror t =
139      this.eventType(typeArgumentSource,
140                     c.isPrimitive() ? d.primitiveType(c.getCanonicalName()) : d.declaredType(d.typeElement(c.getCanonicalName())));
141    for (int i = 0; i < dimensions; i++) {
142      t = d.arrayTypeOf(t);
143    }
144    return t;
145  }
146
147  // This MUST NOT become public.
148  private final TypeMirror eventType(final TypeMirror typeArgumentSource, final TypeMirror eventType) {
149    //
150    // Given:
151    //
152    //   class Sup<S, T> {}
153    //   class Sub<A, B> extends Sup<T, S> {}
154    //   class Sub2<T> extends Sup<String, T> {}
155    //
156    //       +-----------------------+-------------+--------------------------+---------------------------------------------------+
157    //       | typeArgumentSource    | eventType   | return value/exception   | notes                                             |
158    // +-----+-----------------------+-------------+--------------------------+---------------------------------------------------+
159    // |  1. | N/A                   | int         | int                      | (typeArgumentSource not checked or used)          |
160    // |  2. | N/A                   | int[]       | int[]                    | (typeArgumentSource not checked or used)          |
161    // |  3. | N/A                   | Object      | Object                   | (typeArgumentSource not checked or used)          |
162    // |  4. | N/A                   | Object[]    | Object[]                 | (typeArgumentSource not checked or used)          |
163    // |  5. | int                   | ArrayList   | IllegalArgumentException | (typeArgumentSource cannot supply type arguments) |
164    // |  6. | int[]                 | ArrayList   | IllegalArgumentException | (typeArgumentSource cannot supply type arguments) |
165    // |  7. | List                  | ArrayList   | IllegalArgumentException | (typeArgumentSource cannot supply type arguments) |
166    // |  8. | List[]                | ArrayList   | IllegalArgumentException | (typeArgumentSource cannot supply type arguments) |
167    // |  9. | AbstractList<String>  | ArrayList   | ArrayList<String>        |                                                   |
168    // | 10. | List<String>[]        | ArrayList[] | ArrayList<String>[]      |                                                   |
169    // | 11. | List<String>[]        | ArrayList   | ArrayList<String>        | (typeArgumentSource dimensions don't matter)      |
170    // | 12. | List<T>               | ArrayList   | IllegalArgumentException | (type arguments must be declared or array types)  |
171    // | 13. | List<T>[]             | ArrayList   | IllegalArgumentException | (type arguments must be declared or array types)  |
172    // | 14. | List<?>               | ArrayList   | IllegalArgumentException | (type arguments must be declared or array types)  |
173    // | 15. | List<?>[]             | ArrayList   | IllegalArgumentException | (type arguments must be declared or array types)  |
174    // | 16. | Map<String, String>   | ArrayList   | IllegalArgumentException | (typeArgumentSource is not a supertype)           |
175    // | 17. | Sup<String, Object>   | Sub         | Sub<Object, String>      |                                                   |
176    // | 18. | Sup<String, Object>   | Sub2        | Sub2<Object>             |                                                   |
177    // +-----+-----------------------+-------------+--------------------------+---------------------------------------------------+
178    //
179    return switch (eventType.getKind()) {
180    case ARRAY -> {
181      final Domain d = this.domain();
182      int dimensions = 1;
183      TypeMirror t = ((ArrayType)eventType).getComponentType();
184      while (t.getKind() == ARRAY) {
185        t = ((ArrayType)t).getComponentType();
186        ++dimensions;
187      }
188      yield switch (t.getKind()) {
189      case ARRAY -> throw new AssertionError();
190      case BOOLEAN, BYTE, CHAR, DOUBLE, FLOAT, INT, LONG, SHORT -> eventType; // Case 2 above
191      case DECLARED -> {
192        t = this.eventType(typeArgumentSource, (DeclaredType)t); // see below
193        assert t.getKind() == DECLARED;
194        for (int i = 0; i < dimensions; i++) {
195          t = d.arrayTypeOf(t);
196        }
197        yield t;
198      }
199      default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException("eventType: " + eventType);
200      };
201    }
202    case BOOLEAN, BYTE, CHAR, DOUBLE, FLOAT, INT, LONG, SHORT -> eventType; // Case 1 above
203    case DECLARED -> this.eventType(typeArgumentSource, (DeclaredType)eventType); // see below
204    default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException("eventType: " + eventType);
205    };
206  }
207
208  private final TypeMirror eventType(TypeMirror typeArgumentSource, final DeclaredType eventType) {
209    if (eventType.getKind() != DECLARED) {
210      throw new IllegalArgumentException("eventType: " + eventType);
211    }
212
213    final TypeElement eventTypeElement = (TypeElement)eventType.asElement();
214    final int typeParametersCount = eventTypeElement.getTypeParameters().size();
215    if (typeParametersCount <= 0) {
216      // Non-generic declared type. Case 3 above (and 4 by extension).
217      return eventType;
218    }
219
220    // Optimization: if all the event type type arguments are already of kind ARRAY or DECLARED or WILDCARD, then we're
221    // done. Otherwise there is at least one type argument that has to be inferred.
222    final List<? extends TypeMirror> eventTypeTypeArguments = eventType.getTypeArguments();
223    OPTIMIZATION:
224    if (!eventTypeTypeArguments.isEmpty()) {
225      for (final TypeMirror ta : eventTypeTypeArguments) {
226        switch (ta.getKind()) {
227        case TYPEVAR:
228          // Optimization does not apply; break out of the OPTIMIZATION block entirely
229          break OPTIMIZATION;
230        case ARRAY:
231        case DECLARED:
232        case WILDCARD:
233          break; // go to the next for loop iteration
234        default:
235          throw new AssertionError("ta: " + ta);
236        }
237      }
238      return eventType;
239    }
240
241    // "De-arrayize" the specified type; whether it is an array or not does not matter. We only care about its element
242    // type since that is the source of inferred/replacement type arguments.
243    final TypeMirror originalTypeArgumentSource = typeArgumentSource;
244    while (typeArgumentSource.getKind() == ARRAY) {
245      typeArgumentSource = ((ArrayType)typeArgumentSource).getComponentType();
246    }
247    if (typeArgumentSource.getKind() != DECLARED) {
248      throw new IllegalArgumentException("typeArgumentSource: " + originalTypeArgumentSource + "; eventType: " + eventType);
249    }
250
251    final TypeElement typeArgumentSourceElement = (TypeElement)((DeclaredType)typeArgumentSource).asElement();
252
253    // The event type is a generic declared type. As we begin, it is important in what follows to use the prototypical
254    // type, not a raw type. The prototypical type will ensure that type parameter arguments (type variables) will be
255    // "propagated" up the inheritance hierarchy.
256    //
257    // (The concept of a prototypical type is not defined in the Java Language Specification but only in the Java
258    // language model specification. See
259    // https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/25/docs/api/java.compiler/javax/lang/model/element/TypeElement.html#prototypicaltype.)
260    //
261    // For example, suppose the event type is ArrayList<String>. We "go up" to its element via asElement(), yielding the
262    // TypeElement ArrayList. Then we "go down" using its asType() argument, which does _not_ yield ArrayList<String>,
263    // but, rather, ArrayList<E>. ArrayList<E> is the prototypical type defined by the TypeElement ArrayList. The
264    // getSuperclass() method on the ArrayList TypeElement "propagates" E-defined-by-ArrayList "up" to AbstractList<E>,
265    // such that the E in AbstractList<E> simply is the E-defined-by-ArrayList.
266    final DeclaredType eventPrototypicalType = (DeclaredType)eventTypeElement.asType();
267    assert !eventPrototypicalType.getTypeArguments().isEmpty();
268    assert allAreTypeVariables(eventPrototypicalType.getTypeArguments());
269
270    // Given, e.g:
271    //
272    //   class Sup<S, T> {}
273    //   class Sub<A, B> extends Sup<B, A> {}
274    //
275    // ...and:
276    //
277    //   Sup<String, Object> // specified type
278    //
279    // ...we want to (ultimately) yield Sub<Object, String>.
280    //
281    // Visually, in what follows, the "right hand side" is the event type hierarchy starting from the prototypical event
282    // type. The "left hand side" is specified type usage.
283    //
284    // We need to substitute type arguments from the "left hand side" appropriately into the "right hand side".
285
286    // First, get the "congruent supertype" (a term I made up). Given Sub<A, B> (the prototypical event type), yield
287    // Sup<B, A> (not Sup<S, T>). It is congruent with Sup<String, Object> in some fashion.
288    final DeclaredType rhs = congruentSupertype(typeArgumentSourceElement, eventPrototypicalType);
289    if (rhs == null) {
290      // typeArgumentSource and eventType were distinct types. We COULD take type arguments from the specified type but that
291      // would ultimately be very confusing and almost certainly reflects programmer error.
292      throw new IllegalArgumentException("typeArgumentSource: " + originalTypeArgumentSource + "; eventType: " + eventType);
293    } else if (rhs == eventPrototypicalType) {
294      // Optimization:
295      //
296      // The contract of congruentSupertype() says that when the return value is identical to the second argument then
297      // no substitution was necessary. If no substitution was necessary, then just return what we already know.
298      return eventType;
299    }
300
301    // B, A in Sup<B, A>
302    final List<? extends TypeMirror> rhsTypeArguments = rhs.getTypeArguments();
303    assert allAreTypeVariables(rhsTypeArguments) : "rhsTypeArguments: " + rhsTypeArguments;
304
305    // Sup in Sup<B, A>
306    final TypeElement rhsTypeElement = (TypeElement)rhs.asElement();
307
308    // Now we have the proper left and right hand sides suitable for type argument substitution (Sup<String, Object> and
309    // Sup<B, A> respectively).
310
311    // String, Object in Sup<String, Object>
312    final List<? extends TypeMirror> lhsTypeArguments = ((DeclaredType)typeArgumentSource).getTypeArguments();
313
314    int size = lhsTypeArguments.size();
315    if (size <= 0) {
316      // lhs was non-generic or raw and hence is incapable of supplying (needed) type arguments.
317      throw new IllegalArgumentException("typeArgumentSource: " + originalTypeArgumentSource + "; eventType: " + eventType);
318    }
319
320    // This Map will hold entries mapping, e.g., B to String and A to Object. For visualization purposes, this
321    // "connects" the left hand side to the right hand side. The map will have a size that is guaranteed to be exactly
322    // equal to the number of type parameters.
323    final Map<TypeVariable, TypeMirror> m = newHashMap(size);
324
325    for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
326
327      // For every left hand side type argument...
328
329      // On the left hand side:
330      //
331      // Sup<S,      T     >
332      //    <String, Object>
333
334      // String, Object
335      final TypeMirror lhsTypeArgument = lhsTypeArguments.get(i);
336      switch (lhsTypeArgument.getKind()) {
337      case ARRAY:
338      case DECLARED:
339      case WILDCARD:
340        break;
341      default:
342        throw new IllegalArgumentException("typeArgumentSource: " + typeArgumentSource);
343      }
344
345      // On the right hand side:
346      //
347      // Sup<B, A>
348
349      // B, A
350      final TypeMirror rhsTypeArgument = rhsTypeArguments.get(i);
351      switch (rhsTypeArgument.getKind()) {
352      case ARRAY:
353      case DECLARED:
354        // This argument is already taken care of. We're interested only in replacing type variables with
355        // non-type-variable reference types.
356        continue;
357      case TYPEVAR:
358        break;
359      case WILDCARD:
360        // (Don't have to handle wildcards because we're working with the prototypical type hierarchy on the right hand
361        // side which will never have them.)
362        // fall through
363      default:
364        // Other type kinds are not reference type kinds.
365        throw new AssertionError();
366      }
367      final TypeVariable rhsTypeVariable = (TypeVariable)rhsTypeArgument;
368
369      // Assert that B and A in Sup<B, A> are type variables defined by Sub<A, B>. (This is why using the prototypical
370      // type was important; see above.)
371      assert
372        ((TypeParameterElement)rhsTypeVariable.asElement()).getGenericElement().equals(eventPrototypicalType.asElement()) :
373      "rhsTypeVariable.asElement(): " + rhsTypeVariable.asElement() +
374        "; ((TypeParameterElement)rhsTypeVariable.asElement()).getGenericElement(): " + ((TypeParameterElement)rhsTypeVariable.asElement()).getGenericElement() +
375        "; eventPrototypicalElementType.asElement(): " + eventPrototypicalType.asElement();
376
377      // B in Sup<B, A> := String
378      // A in Sup<B, A> := Object
379      m.put(rhsTypeVariable, lhsTypeArgument);
380
381    }
382
383    if (m.isEmpty()) {
384      // No entries in the map means no substitution was performed for whatever reason, so return the event type unchanged.
385      return eventType;
386    }
387
388    // Use the proper type arguments we stored in the Map; e.g. use Object for A (S) and String for B (T).
389
390    // Use the type parameters from the left hand side type element, because that may represent a supertype. The
391    // substitutions we stored line up one for one with these type parameters.
392    //
393    // For example, consider a supertype (left hand side) of AbstractMap<K, V>, a usage of it (AbstractMap<String,
394    // Object>), and a subtype of class SpecialMap<V> extends AbstractMap<String, V>.
395
396    final List<? extends TypeParameterElement> tpes = eventTypeElement.getTypeParameters();
397    size = tpes.size();
398    final List<TypeMirror> tas = new ArrayList<>(size);
399    for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
400      final TypeMirror ta = m.get(tpes.get(i).asType());
401      assert ta != null : "tpe: " + tpes.get(i) + "; tpe.asType(): " + tpes.get(i).asType() + "; tpe.getGenericElement(): " + tpes.get(i).getGenericElement() + "; m: " + m;
402      tas.add(ta);
403    }
404    assert !tas.isEmpty() : "tas: " + tas;
405    return this.domain().declaredType(eventTypeElement, tas.toArray(new TypeMirror[0]));
406  }
407
408
409  /*
410   * Static methods.
411   */
412
413
414  private static final boolean allAreTypeVariables(final Iterable<? extends TypeMirror> i) {
415    for (final TypeMirror t : i) {
416      if (t.getKind() != TYPEVAR) {
417        return false;
418      }
419    }
420    return true;
421  }
422
423  /**
424   * Returns {@code true} if and only if the supplied {@link TypeMirror} is a <dfn>legal event type</dfn>.
425   *
426   * <p>Legal event types are, exactly:</p>
427   *
428   * <ol>
429   *
430   * <li>{@linkplain javax.lang.model.type.TypeKind#ARRAY Array} types whose {@linkplain ArrayType#getComponentType()
431   * component type}s are primitive types or legal event types</li>
432   *
433   * <li>{@linkplain javax.lang.model.type.TypeKind#DECLARED Declared} types that do not refer to type variables</li>
434   *
435   * </ol>
436   *
437   * @param t a {@link TypeMirror}; must not be {@code null}
438   *
439   * @return {@code true} if and only if {@code t} is a legal event type; {@code false} otherwise
440   *
441   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
442   *
443   * @microbean.idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
444   *
445   * @microbean.threadsafety This method itself is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads, but {@link TypeMirror}
446   * implementations and {@link Domain} implementations may not be safe for such use.
447   */
448  public static final boolean legalEventType(final TypeMirror t) {
449    // https://jakarta.ee/specifications/cdi/4.0/jakarta-cdi-spec-4.0#event_types_and_qualifier_types
450    return switch (t.getKind()) {
451
452    case ARRAY -> {
453      final TypeMirror componentType = ((ArrayType)t).getComponentType();
454      if (!componentType.getKind().isPrimitive() && !legalEventType(componentType)) {
455        if (LOGGER.isLoggable(WARNING)) {
456          LOGGER.log(WARNING, t + " has a component type that is an illegal event type (" + componentType);
457        }
458        yield false;
459      }
460      yield true;
461    }
462
463    // As of this writing, you can't fire a primitive event in CDI, because the fire() method takes an Object, but
464    // there's nothing stopping a primitive event type from being legal otherwise (you can envision a fire(int) method,
465    // for example). Consequently, this may end up being uncommented later.
466    //
467    // case BOOLEAN, BYTE, CHAR, DOUBLE, FLOAT, INT, LONG, SHORT -> true;
468
469    case DECLARED -> {
470      // "An event type may not contain an unresolvable [sic] type variable. A wildcard type is not considered an
471      // unresolvable type variable."
472      //
473      // We interpret "contain" to mean "have as a type argument, or as a wildcard bound, recursively, anywhere".
474      for (final TypeMirror ta : ((DeclaredType)t).getTypeArguments()) {
475        switch (ta.getKind()) {
476        case WILDCARD:
477          final WildcardType wta = (WildcardType)ta;
478          TypeMirror b = wta.getExtendsBound();
479          if (b != null && !legalEventType(b)) {
480            if (LOGGER.isLoggable(WARNING)) {
481              LOGGER.log(WARNING, t + " has a type argument that is an illegal event type (" + ta + ")");
482            }
483            yield false;
484          }
485          b = wta.getSuperBound();
486          if (b != null && !legalEventType(b)) {
487            if (LOGGER.isLoggable(WARNING)) {
488              LOGGER.log(WARNING, t + " has a type argument that is an illegal event type (" + ta + ")");
489            }
490            yield false;
491          }
492          break;
493        default:
494          if (!legalEventType(ta)) {
495            if (LOGGER.isLoggable(WARNING)) {
496              LOGGER.log(WARNING, t + " has a type argument that is an illegal event type (" + ta + ")");
497            }
498            yield false;
499          }
500          break;
501        }
502      }
503      yield true;
504    }
505
506    default -> {
507      // (Including, of course, TYPEVAR.)
508      if (LOGGER.isLoggable(WARNING)) {
509        LOGGER.log(WARNING, t + " is an illegal event type");
510      }
511      yield false;
512    }
513    };
514  }
515
516  /**
517   * Returns {@code true} if and only if the supplied {@link TypeMirror} is a <dfn>legal observed event type</dfn>.
518   *
519   * <p>A legal observed event type is <a
520   * href="https://jakarta.ee/specifications/cdi/4.0/jakarta-cdi-spec-4.0#event_types_and_qualifier_types">any Java type
521   * that a method parameter may bear</a>.
522   *
523   * @param t a {@link TypeMirror}; must not be {@code null}
524   *
525   * @return {@code true} if and only if {@code t} is a legal observed event type; {@code false} otherwise
526   *
527   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
528   *
529   * @microbean.idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
530   *
531   * @microbean.threadsafety This method itself is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads, but {@link TypeMirror}
532   * implementations and {@link Domain} implementations may not be safe for such use.
533   */
534  public static final boolean legalObservedEventType(final TypeMirror t) {
535    // https://jakarta.ee/specifications/cdi/4.0/jakarta-cdi-spec-4.0#event_types_and_qualifier_types
536    // "Any Java type [that a method parameter element may bear] may be an observed event type."
537    return switch (t.getKind()) {
538    case ARRAY, BOOLEAN, BYTE, CHAR, DECLARED, DOUBLE, FLOAT, INT, LONG, SHORT, TYPEVAR -> true;
539    default -> false;
540    };
541  }
542
543  private static final DeclaredType congruentSupertype(final TypeElement lhsTypeElement, DeclaredType subtype) {
544    if (subtype.getKind() != DECLARED) {
545      throw new IllegalArgumentException("subtype: " + subtype);
546    }
547    if (lhsTypeElement == null) {
548      return subtype;
549    }
550    // Make sure the subtype is the prototypical subtype. Very important.
551    TypeElement subtypeTypeElement = (TypeElement)subtype.asElement();
552    if (subtype.getTypeArguments().isEmpty()) {
553      subtype = (DeclaredType)subtypeTypeElement.asType();
554    }
555    TypeElement rhsTypeElement = subtypeTypeElement;
556    DeclaredType rhs = subtype;
557    while (rhsTypeElement != null && !lhsTypeElement.equals(rhsTypeElement)) {
558      final TypeMirror rhsSuperclass = rhsTypeElement.getSuperclass();
559      switch (rhsSuperclass.getKind()) {
560      case NONE:
561        rhs = null;
562        rhsTypeElement = null; // no superclass means it was Object
563        break;
564      case DECLARED:
565        rhs = (DeclaredType)rhsSuperclass; // extremely important
566        rhsTypeElement = (TypeElement)rhs.asElement();
567        break;
568      }
569    }
570    if (rhsTypeElement == null) {
571      final Set<TypeElement> seen = new HashSet<>();
572      final List<TypeMirror> interfaces = new LinkedList<>();
573      for (final TypeMirror iface : subtypeTypeElement.getInterfaces()) {
574        if (seen.add((TypeElement)((DeclaredType)iface).asElement())) {
575          interfaces.add(iface);
576        }
577      }
578      INTERFACES_LOOP:
579      while (!interfaces.isEmpty()) {
580        final DeclaredType iface = (DeclaredType)interfaces.removeFirst();
581        final TypeElement ifaceTypeElement = (TypeElement)iface.asElement();
582        if (lhsTypeElement.equals(ifaceTypeElement)) {
583          // we're done
584          rhs = iface; // extremely important
585          break INTERFACES_LOOP;
586        }
587        for (final TypeMirror superinterface : ifaceTypeElement.getInterfaces()) {
588          if (seen.add((TypeElement)((DeclaredType)superinterface).asElement())) {
589            interfaces.add(superinterface);
590          }
591        }
592      }
593    }
594    return rhs;
595  }
596
